messages.title: MODERATE CONSERVATIVES SPEAK OUT
messages.content: Comments from Conservative figures expressing distrust in Boris Johnson and considering supporting the Liberal Democrats.

messages.title: JEREMY CORBYN BACKS BREXIT
messages.content: Criticism of Jeremy Corbyn's stance on Brexit, suggesting Labour puts remain voters at risk and always voted with Conservative Brexiters.

messages.title: YOUR CHOICE FOR THIS ELECTION
messages.content: Claims that the Conservatives can't win in Oxford, implying a two-horse race between Labour and the Liberal Democrats.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: The leaflet suggests that Alistair Fernie and the Liberal Democrats are opposed to Brexit, in contrast to the positions of Boris Johnson and Jeremy Corbyn.

mentions.tacticalSituation: It's been 36 years since Tories won in Oxford East and they haven't even elected a councillor since then. Tactical voting suggestion towards Liberal Democrats.

issues.brexitEurope: Anti-Brexit stance mentioned, opposing both Conservative and Labour's positions.

quotes.text: I'm impressed by Jo Swinson. I think if I was living in a lot of constituencies I would lend my vote to the Liberal Democrats.
I'm not sure yet, but I may protest and vote Lib Dem.
quotes.source: Ken Clarke - Conservative MP for 49 years

quotes.text: Millions of Tories will now vote Lib Dem because of Brexit.

images.caption: Alistair Fernie - Building a brighter future for Oxford East.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Conservative figures quoted are against Boris Johnson's approach, implying a cross-party support for the Liberal Democrats in the context of Brexit.
